body.p:
Mays Lick Ky Sept 6th 1865 --
Lieut Col Patton
Sir
Your note is before me asking of me to give you in writing what I know about the authority given you to raise troops in Ky by Genl Jno S Willliams

In the Summer of 1863 Genl Sam Jones (then Commanding the Dept of SW Va & East Tenne Recd authority from the Sect of War of C. S. A. to raise troop in Ky & South W Va, that authority was handed to Genl J S Williams and he ^was^ ordered to the border of Ky for that purpose. His order was a "Cart Blanch" to raise them as he Williams though best; on Genl Williams arriving at Saltville Va he gave authority to Col A J May, ^Col^ Henry S. Bowen to raise two Regmts in Va which they did, Col May had a small battalion of Kentuckians at that time from Ky, he raised 6 Companies from the County of Buckhannon ^Va^ which completed 10 companies for him making what is known as the 10th Ky

Col Bowen under that authority raised the 22d Va Cavalary and Col Peters the 21st Va C Genl Williams gave you, Col John D Morris (of Christian Co Ky) and myself, the authority to raise Regiments in Ky, you and Col Morris come to Ky to fulfill your Mission, and I afterwards learned, you were both Captured

I was engaged in the Medical department and could not leave at the time you did, which I think was fortunate for me or
in all probablity I should have shared your fate -- I have my authority I suppose still in my trunk at wWytheville Va and I will write for it
